content.description: This mini-climb lies on a large boulder just past the Slash boulder.  The route has 2 bolts, and goes to a 2 bolt anchor.  It faces the Slash boulder.
content.location: Hike just past the Slash boulder;  there it is on the left.

climbs.name: Equinox
climbs.fa: Dennis Johnson, 1972; FFA (TR) John Bachar, May 1978; First Lead: Tony Yaniro,  August1980

content.description:
The line of the route is not hard to spot. It is a unique crack up the vertical west face of the giant boulder which forms the summit of Jerry's Quarry. The start of the crack is thin fingers, and is is covered partially by a huge "ear-like" flake. Mantle onto this, and continue up the thin crack with increasing difficulty. The crux comes at about 25 feet when the footholds vanish and the face overhangs a degree or two past vertical. After this, some nice finger locks replace the desperate finger-tip jams, and the angle eases slightly. Be sure to utilize the tiny but solid edges under the crack for your feet. Just before the mantle onto the summit, you have an almost no-hands rest, and one you will want to milk! At the top, savour your send of one of the world's finest routes, at one time one of the first routes graded 5.13, (hey, they had EB's and straight-sided nuts).

It's possible to scramble around the backside, where there's usually a short piece of rope to yard up and over the top, if you want a toprope.
content.protection: Despite the widening appearance of the crack near the top, the largest pro it takes is #3 TCU (or #1 friends). Take 2 each TCU's #1 and #2, one #3 and some finger sized stoppers.

climbs.name: Elephant Walk
climbs.fa: Mari Gingery, Tom Gilje, John Yablonski & Mike Lechlinski, January 1988

content.description:
Start up a low angled ramp (gear) to access the hanging arete which offers continuously steep and technical movement throughout it's length which culminates with

a geologic anomaly - a perfect two finger pocket.
content.protection:
5 bolts, anchors (same as Equinox)

A 3 - 3.5 inch cam is useful before the first bolt
content.location:
A very good and somewhat exciting climb up the blunt arete left of

Equinox

.

pathTokens: Jerry's Quarry and Lost Pencil Areas
